description: Sample MCQ questions for roadmap certifications. Use the admin panel at /admin/admin-panel/roadmap-questions to add these to your roadmaps.
usage:
1. Go to Admin Panel > Roadmap Questions
2. Select a roadmap
3. Copy questions from the appropriate category below
4. Paste into the question editor

Web Development.question: What does HTML stand for?
Web Development.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, the standard markup language for creating web pages.

Web Development.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
Web Development.explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the text color of an element.

Web Development.question: What is the correct way to declare a JavaScript variable?
Web Development.explanation: In JavaScript, variables can be declared using let, const, or var keywords.

Web Development.question: Which HTTP method is typically used to submit form data?
Web Development.explanation: POST is commonly used to submit form data as it sends data in the request body, not the URL.

Web Development.question: What is the purpose of the 'box-sizing: border-box' CSS property?
options: Adds a border to all elements
Includes padding and border in element's total width/height
Web Development.explanation: border-box makes width/height calculations include padding and border, making layouts more predictable.

Web Development.question: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink in HTML?
Web Development.explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

Web Development.question: What does CSS stand for?
Web Development.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used to style HTML documents.

Web Development.question: Which JavaScript method is used to select an element by its ID?
Web Development.explanation: document.getElementById() is used to select a single element by its ID attribute.

Web Development.question: What is the default display value for a <div> element?
Web Development.explanation: By default, <div> elements have display: block, meaning they take up the full width available.

Web Development.question: Which attribute is required for the tag to be valid HTML?
Web Development.explanation: The src attribute specifying the image source is required, though alt is strongly recommended for accessibility.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is the time complexity of binary search?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Binary search divides the search space in half each iteration, giving O(log n) complexity.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In First Out) principle?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: A Stack follows LIFO - the last element added is the first one to be removed.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is the worst-case time complexity of QuickSort?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: QuickSort's worst case is O(n²) when the pivot selection is poor (e.g., already sorted array).

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: Which data structure is best for implementing a priority queue?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Heaps provide O(log n) insertion and O(1) access to the highest priority element.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is the space complexity of merge sort?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Merge sort requires O(n) additional space for the temporary arrays during merging.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: Which traversal visits nodes in the order: Left, Root, Right?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Inorder traversal visits left subtree, then root, then right subtree (L-R-R).

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is a hash collision?
options: When a hash table is full
When two keys hash to the same index
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: A collision occurs when two different keys produce the same hash value/index.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array by index?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Arrays provide O(1) constant time access by index due to contiguous memory storage.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: Which algorithm is used to find the shortest path in a weighted graph?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Dijkstra's algorithm finds the shortest path from a source to all vertices in a weighted graph.

Data Structures & Algorithms.question: What is the main advantage of a doubly linked list over a singly linked list?
Data Structures & Algorithms.explanation: Doubly linked lists allow traversal in both directions, useful for operations like deletion.

React.question: What is the virtual DOM in React?
options: A lightweight copy of the real DOM
React.explanation: The virtual DOM is a lightweight JavaScript representation of the real DOM that React uses for efficient updates.

React.question: Which hook is used to manage state in functional components?
React.explanation: useState is the primary hook for adding state to functional components.

React.question: What is the purpose of useEffect hook?
React.explanation: useEffect handles side effects like data fetching, subscriptions, and DOM manipulation.

React.question: What is JSX?
React.explanation: JSX is a syntax extension that allows writing HTML-like code in JavaScript files.

React.question: Which method is called when a component is first rendered?
React.explanation: componentDidMount is called once after the component is first rendered to the DOM.

React.question: What is the correct way to pass data from parent to child component?
React.explanation: Props (properties) are the standard way to pass data from parent to child components.

React.question: What is the purpose of React.memo?
React.explanation: React.memo is a higher-order component that memoizes components to prevent unnecessary re-renders.

React.question: What is the key prop used for in React lists?
options: Helping React identify which items changed
React.explanation: Keys help React identify which items have changed, been added, or removed for efficient updates.

React.question: Which hook would you use for complex state logic?
React.explanation: useReducer is preferred for complex state logic involving multiple sub-values or next state dependencies.

React.question: What is the purpose of useCallback hook?
React.explanation: useCallback memoizes functions to prevent unnecessary re-creation on every render.

Python.question: What is the output of print(type([]))?
Python.explanation: [] creates an empty list in Python, so type([]) returns <class 'list'>.

Python.question: Which keyword is used to create a function in Python?
Python.explanation: The 'def' keyword is used to define functions in Python.

Python.question: What is a Python decorator?
options: A function that modifies another function
Python.explanation: Decorators are functions that modify the behavior of other functions without changing their code.

Python.question: What is the difference between a list and a tuple?
options: Lists are mutable, tuples are immutable
Python.explanation: Lists are mutable (can be changed), while tuples are immutable (cannot be changed after creation).

Python.question: What does the 'self' parameter represent in a class method?
Python.explanation: 'self' refers to the current instance of the class, allowing access to instance attributes and methods.

Python.question: What is list comprehension in Python?
options: A way to create lists concisely
Python.explanation: List comprehension provides a concise way to create lists: [x for x in iterable].

Python.question: What is the purpose of __init__ method?
Python.explanation: __init__ is the constructor method called when creating a new instance of a class.

Python.question: Which module is used for regular expressions in Python?
Python.explanation: The 're' module provides regular expression matching operations in Python.

Python.question: What is the output of 3 // 2 in Python?
Python.explanation: // is floor division, which returns the largest integer less than or equal to the result.

Python.question: What is a Python generator?
options: A function that returns an iterator
Python.explanation: Generators are functions that yield values one at a time, creating iterators efficiently.

Machine Learning.question: What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: Model performs well on training but poorly on test data
Machine Learning.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns training data too well, including noise, and fails to generalize.

Machine Learning.question: What is the purpose of the activation function in neural networks?
Machine Learning.explanation: Activation functions introduce non-linearity, allowing networks to learn complex patterns.

Machine Learning.question: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised uses labeled data, unsupervised doesn't
Machine Learning.explanation: Supervised learning uses labeled data with known outputs, while unsupervised learning finds patterns without labels.

Machine Learning.question: What does the learning rate control in gradient descent?
Machine Learning.explanation: Learning rate determines how much to adjust parameters in each optimization step.

Machine Learning.question: What is cross-validation?
Machine Learning.explanation: Cross-validation splits data into multiple folds to evaluate model performance more reliably.

Machine Learning.question: What is the vanishing gradient problem?
options: Gradients become too small for learning
Machine Learning.explanation: Vanishing gradients occur when gradients become very small, making it hard for early layers to learn.

Machine Learning.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification problems?
Machine Learning.explanation: Logistic Regression is a classification algorithm despite its name, predicting class probabilities.

Machine Learning.question: What is the purpose of dropout in neural networks?
Machine Learning.explanation: Dropout randomly deactivates neurons during training to prevent overfitting.

Machine Learning.question: What is feature scaling?
options: Normalizing feature values to a similar range
Machine Learning.explanation: Feature scaling normalizes values so all features contribute equally to the model.

Machine Learning.question: What is the bias-variance tradeoff?
Machine Learning.explanation: It's the tradeoff between underfitting (high bias) and overfitting (high variance).
